Approximately 40-60 hours played on the original Battle .net release.

I would not recommend on any level.  There is nothing salvageable here.

The developers have recanted on virtually all their launch promises, a "future promise" that will now never happen, and their release on Steam is a vapid attempt recover their dying player base.

Fortunately Steam is a much better platform, and user reviews are placed front and center of every game.

Unfortunately, by releasing the game for free on Steam and walling off content in the form of DLC, Blizzard is defending itself against potential refunds by dissatisfied customers.

Exercise extra caution if you decide to buy any of the content.

作为守望先锋玩家，我对于守望先锋2的游戏体验本来有着更高的期望，包括PVP以及PVE，现在PVE取消了之前的技能树只能说是高级版的档案行动还需要额外付费，PVP也不怎么样，在我看来这根本不是守望先锋2，他甚至不如守望先锋，只配称为守望先锋1/2，守望先锋0.5。

在5V5模式中即队伍中的坦克角色在切换中互相克制，就像“石头剪刀布”游戏一样。这种情况使得游戏的战术选择变得单一无趣，因为玩家需要根据对方的选择来合理调整自己的英雄，以取得优势，而不是选择自己喜爱的英雄。然而，这种克制关系也可能导致游戏对战显得单一和无趣，因为某一方坦克被克制后，如果不及时切换英雄，可能会让整个游戏变得难以应对，几乎没有取胜的机会。这与“石头剪刀布”的现象相似，强调了英雄的选择对于游戏结果的影响。

然而，在6V6模式下，由于存在双坦，坦克之间的克制关系没有那么明显。双坦也能为输出和辅助英雄提供了更好的保护和输出环境，这使得游戏策略的选择更加广泛。同时，6V6模式也能够让玩家体验到更多的战术组合，不仅仅局限于5V5模式中坦克之间的克制。

此外，游戏音乐和细节对于游戏体验也有着重要影响。守望先锋1有些皮肤所拥有的独特特效和音效为游戏增添了很多魅力，而在守望先锋2中，部分这些元素却似乎被移除或减少，无法理解。我个人更喜欢一代的音乐，因为它能够在比赛前传达出庄重严肃的氛围，而在守望先锋2中，更多是一种快餐式的廉价感，当然肯定也会有别的玩家喜欢。我认为保留守望先锋的原有的音乐，并将其做成可选择的模式，能够让玩家根据自己的喜好来享受游戏中的音乐氛围。守望先锋2的脚步声也是继承了使命召唤19:现代战争2的震耳欲聋，人多起来虽然可以听出来但是依然很乱。武器的枪声也是改的不咋地，比如在开发时号称真枪实录，我看到暴雪确实录了，但是76最后没有采用真枪而是跟直升机一样的声音，安娜的声音很奇怪，麦克雷对声音也很怪跟爆炸似的，唯一声音改的还不错的我觉得就是黑百合的枪声。

在社交互动方面，我认为守望先锋2可以加入守望先锋1中寻找组队功能重新引入游戏中，可以让玩家更容易地找到合适的队友，增强社交联系。此外，我认为保留守望先锋1中的开箱子功能也是很有价值的。即使守望先锋2加入了战令通行证，通过开箱子获得物品的快乐依然可以为游戏体验增色，同时也可以让玩家在游戏中保持一些期待。

在游戏UI方面，守望先锋2的UI到现在为止依然是不咋地，即使这次更新可以看出比之前好了一些，但是人物的头像还是没做高清升分辨率处理，另外粗体的“微软雅黑”简体中文很丑，守望先锋2的UI特效过亮刺眼，以及天使的蓝黄牵线偶尔会完全挡住玩家正面视野。在受到大量伤害时大量的红色遮挡着玩家的视野，使其看不清东西，而这些在守望先锋1里都完全不存在这些问题，守望先锋1里面是黑色和浅黄色明显的提示了玩家又不会遮挡画面。另外比如安娜治疗反馈也远不如之前明显。

另外希望国服早日回归。

总之这是一个守望先锋0.5 + 行动档案1.5 他真的是守望先锋2么


As an Overwatch player, I initially held higher expectations for the gaming experience of Overwatch 2, encompassing both PvP and PvE aspects. However, the current state of PvE, with the removal of the previous skill tree and the requirement for additional payment for what seems like an advanced version of the "Archives" missions, coupled with the lackluster PvP experience, leads me to believe that this fundamentally isn't Overwatch 2. It falls short of even being comparable to the original Overwatch; it might be more fittingly referred to as Overwatch 1/2 or Overwatch 0.5.

In the 5v5 mode, the tank heroes within the team counter each other during switching, akin to a "rock-paper-scissors" game. This situation renders the tactical choices within the game singular and uninteresting, as players are compelled to adjust their hero selection based on the opponent's choices to gain an advantage, rather than selecting their preferred heroes. However, this counterplay dynamic could also result in the game battles feeling monotonous and dull. If one side's tank is countered and a hero isn't switched in time, it can make the entire game challenging to manage, with scarcely any chance of victory. This parallels the "rock-paper-scissors" phenomenon, highlighting the influence of hero selection on the game's outcome.

Yet, in the 6v6 mode, due to the presence of dual tanks, the counterplay relationship between tanks is less conspicuous. Dual tanks also offer improved protection and output conditions for damage and support heroes, broadening the range of strategic choices within the game. Furthermore, the 6v6 mode grants players the opportunity to explore a wider array of tactical combinations, extending beyond the tank-to-tank interactions confined to the 5v5 mode.

Moreover, the impact of game music and details on the gaming experience is substantial. Certain skins in Overwatch 1 possess unique effects and sounds that greatly enhance the game's allure. However, in Overwatch 2, some of these elements seem to have been removed or diminished, which is perplexing. Personally, I favor the music of the first installment, as it effectively conveys a sense of gravity and solemnity prior to matches. In Overwatch 2, there is a prevailing sense of fast-food-like and somewhat inexpensive aesthetics to the music, although undoubtedly there will be other players who appreciate it. Retaining the original Overwatch music and configuring it as an optional mode could enable players to savor the musical ambiance in accordance with their preferences. Overwatch 2's footsteps also bear similarities to the overwhelming auditory impact of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2019; though discernible with a higher player count, they still remain chaotic. Weapon sounds have been modified to a lesser extent, such as Blizzard's claim to employ actual firearm recordings during development. While Blizzard indeed recorded these sounds, Soldier 76's final gunshot didn't utilize authentic firearm sounds, instead resembling that of a helicopter. Ana's voice sounds peculiar, and McCree's voice is unconventional, bordering on explosive. The only sound that has been adequately improved, in my view, is Widowmaker's firearm noise.

In terms of social interaction, I believe that Overwatch 2 should reintegrate the team-finding feature from Overwatch 1, facilitating the process for players to locate suitable teammates and enhancing social connections. Furthermore, preserving the loot box feature from Overwatch 1 remains valuable. Even though Overwatch 2 has introduced a battle pass, the delight derived from obtaining items through loot boxes can still enhance the gaming experience and sustain a sense of anticipation for players.

Addressing the game's user interface, while improvements are discernible in this update, Overwatch 2's UI design still lags. Notably, character without upscaling to high-definition resolution. Additionally, the bold "Microsoft YaHei" Chinese font appears unappealing, and the UI effects in Overwatch 2 are excessively vivid and dazzling, occasionally causing Mercy's blue-yellow beams to obstruct the player's front view entirely. When subjected to substantial damage, an excess of red obscures the player's field of vision, hindering clear perception. These issues do not exist in Overwatch 1, where black and light yellow indicators are prominent without obstructing the view. Furthermore, Ana's healing feedback is noticeably inferior compared to before.

Additionally, I hope that the Chinese Overwatch server will return soon.

In conclusion, it appears to be more of an Overwatch 0.5 combined with an "Archives" 1.5 expansion rather than a genuine Overwatch 2.

[h1]OVERWATCH 2 : A game should not existed in the first place[/h1]

Let me start with some context, I have spent thousands of hours on this game before it was release on steam(including Overwatch 2) , I have reached high diamond/master on competitive play on all three roles(DPS, Support and Tank). It was fun and I have met many friends during my time in Overwatch 1. However there is one of the things I really liked was their PvE content, especially the Archive event, it brings new stories and non recycled PvE content to the game, and also I am a huge fan of CO-OP shooters, but I will only play the PvE mode once or twice due to its lack a replayability. So When Overwatch 2 was announced in BlizzCon 2019 I was very excited because there is finally a replayable, CO-OP shooters that me and few friends can play, so excited in fact I foolishly pre ordered the game's founder pack(or whatever the pre order pack is).

[b]Fastforward to release of Overwatch 2[/b]
The PvE mode that they promised was delayed, which is fine for me, I still waited patiently for that. In the meantime I will keep playing PvP, and boy this too was a huge let down. First, a lot of features has been removed, for example: On Fire, Voting system after match, medals, level boarder, level boarder displayed on every players etc. Then there it is, the Battle Pass and the store, this two things completely replaced the Loot box system, that means you cannot get any of the skins using loot box (loot box can be earned by playing the game, and their drop rate of legendary/epic skins are quite high) you have to buy it through the store or earn it in the battle pass. The skins in the store cost range from $10-$25, often packaged with some trash you dont really need like sprays and icons. BUT you know what, I dont care, I wont spend any money on the game unless I see something cool then. Well I could not be more wrong, ANY future released heroes will be tied to the battle pass, so unless you want to grind the battle pass to level 30 you wont be getting that hero on release. That brings to the PvP. They reduced from 6vs6 to 5vs5 which is massive and controversial. Me however, appreciate this change, for so long overwatch team fight has been very chaotic, making it 5v5 seems like a good change to make team fight shorter and requires more team work. So they locked heroes behind the battle pass, which means in a game where you often switch heroes, you cannot switch to the new hero, which is often overpowered on release. so If the other team has it, there is a great chance that you will lose to it and there is nothing you can do except grind that hero or put out your wallet. Also the hero balancing was so bad, that they have to disable Bastion and Mei for a period of time in order to fix them, even the ones that are playable was broken like Orisa who literally cannot die because her CD on fortify is like 5 seconds. Cassidy with his heat seeking grenade that can track you across the map or Sombra who can one clip a tank with her hack, like why arent these hero balanced before release or why is it even changed in the first place?

[b]The Killing Blow[/b]
The new broke out around June that the replayable PvE was cancelled, the reason was they could not meet their original vision for the game, but I kept my expectations really low but holy shit I didnt expect this coming. But then Blizzard just couldnt keep their mouth shut and had come up and say: "Its not cancelled, the PvE is still coming, the campaign mode is sitll coming." and honestly FUCK YOU. Turns out the PvE mode was cancelled and stopped its development as early as 2021, still months away from launching the game. Why didnt announced it back then? because they can take all your pre orders and give it to Bobby Cuntick and his horny higher ups at Blizzard so they can abuse more women at the office. and after all that this company have the fucking BALLS to charge 20 dollars for the campaign? seriously? I can live with most of the crappy changes made to the game but this officially made me quit the game once and for all, because it is not worth my time and my money.

[b]It should not existed in the first place[/b]
Overwatch 2 should never existed in the first place, all those changes and adjustments are just enough to call it a Overwatch 1.5. The main selling point of OW2 was the replayable PvE, now that is gone and its only a shadow of its former self, this should have been just Overwatch Update 2.0 or something, it is not worthy to be called a "Sequal". However I hold no grudge against the devs and all the people who worked on the game even Aaron Keller who is the lead dev. As a game developer myself I understand sometimes it is hard to meet all the goals in production and failed to meet the vision you had for the game, but as a customer, I dont care, I dont care how hard you worked on the game, I want my game to be the the game you promised me, I want the game that I paid $60 of my hard earned money to be good. Think of it by ordering a burger, if the burger tastes like shit, I do not care how much effort you put in to make this burger, i dont want it and i just going to ask for a refund...well in this case Blizzard will never refund my pre order. Bringing it steam was a brave move tho, which i am sure it will be bombarded with negative reviews. Keep up the thumbs down and memes everyone!

The missions and cinematics were lovely. I enjoyed every single part of it, didnt feel annoying, or repetitive, was challenging and a pleasurable experience overall. Sad though that they need to be purchased separately in a 15€ bundle.... if they were sold for 5€ it would be waaay more atractive. without the extra "1000 coins" in it...  but welp.

Same old story, Love the game, Hate the company. Hoping microsoft will make overwatch a better game with time... Just want to see more of these missions, more frequently, keep us players engaged, and new content flowing in. that's what can keep this game's potential to the max, and make it the best it could ever be.... Overwatch 1 has been the game of the year.... overwatch 2 might someday reach that spot again..... if the development team gets the investment they deserve.  They can do this... if they are allowed to make this game the dream we all have. the world needs more heroes... and we are here to rotate it.

Primero agradecer a Steam por poder tener este espacio para que los jugadores se expresen. Overwatch fue un gran juego . Pero la compañía cada día lo hace peor.  Promueven contenido  contenido que no llega, dan escusas malas. Cobros a precio de juego nuevo por dlc.  Contenido repetitvo y lento en generarse. Ranked que no tienen ni un sentido lógico (mas son como la loot boxes , azar).   Si quieren saber como matar una franquicia contraten a los actuales directos de blizzard , camino asegurado.. Única esperanza que microsoft reemplazo a toda la plana de blizzard y con suerte podría mejorar la compañía.

守望？这不是守望，这是烤迪克木琴的古灰盒，体积小方便携带，拆开一包，放水里就散开，怎么找都找不回来，用来泡水，冲厕所，拖地都是很好用的，你看打开以后像奶茶粉一样碎，放在水里遇水溶解不见，溶解性很强的。冲开以后，是一杯强效加量的洁厕灵，你看它怎么用都用不完，不掉伤手不伤地，使用一辈子都没问题，大扫除带上它非常方便，用它洗袜子，再拖地板，冲厕所，干净卫生。什么?在哪里买?右上角寿衣商店，买一盒送一盒
